intro: Tarenna wajirensis, commonly known as the Wajirensis tarenna, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow when mature. Tarenna wajirensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
